definition: not knowing which course to follow (idiom); at a loss what to do
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]
surname Shi
to fit/suitable/proper/just (now)/comfortable/well/to go/to follow or pursue

from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor
surname Cong

sentences.english: Effects and animations can potentially be overwhelming to desktop application users.
sentences.chinese: 效果和動畫有可能會讓桌面應用程序用戶無所適從。

sentences.english: Society has been disoriented by changing values.
sentences.chinese: 變化的價值觀使社會感到無所適從。

sentences.english: He had no choice except to spit it out.
sentences.chinese: 逼得他無所適從，只好一吐爲快。

sentences.english: The chairman was distracted between different opinions.
sentences.chinese: 主席被不同意見弄得無所適從。

sentences.english: In the country the vast electorate was restless and adrift.
sentences.chinese: 在國內，廣大的選民浮躁不安，徬徨而無所適從。

sentences.english: Even if I leave my standard headphones at home, I'm not stuck anymore.
sentences.chinese: 即便是我將標準耳機遺忘在家，我也不會無所適從。

sentences.english: All this makes business people extremely nervous.
sentences.chinese: 所有這些讓商人們無所適從。

sentences.english: For me, there are too many options.
sentences.chinese: 這麼多的選擇讓我無所適從。

sentences.english: I am self fanciful ideas but bewilder.
sentences.chinese: 我自己假想的想法卻無所適從。

sentences.english: Seeing all these disks can leave you a bit at sea.
sentences.chinese: 看着這一大堆磁盤可能讓您感到無所適從。

sentences.english: Our courtship rituals are rapidly changing, and we don’t know what to do.
sentences.chinese: 我們的求偶儀式快速的變化，以致我們無所適從。

sentences.english: However, the vast number of extensions available for Firefox can be a bit overwhelming.
sentences.chinese: 然而，多如牛毛的火狐擴展會讓用戶感到無所適從。

sentences.english: Too much information may make marketing staff not know which to select .
sentences.chinese: 信息過多過濫也會使得營銷人員無所適從。

sentences.english: Whenever Saul was confused about what to do, he would always go to his sagacious grandfather for advice.
sentences.chinese: 索爾感到無所適從時總會向他睿智的祖父尋求建議。

sentences.english: James was at a loss as to what to do and felt lost.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯無所適從，惘然若失。

sentences.english: The result has been confusion among business and bureaucrats alike about how it will work.
sentences.chinese: 然而該如何操作，企業方面和有關部門一樣無所適從。

definition: to make progress only with great difficulty (idiom)
to turn a blind eye to
preconceived idea/bias/prejudice
to bother/to disturb/to vex
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
hard to understand/incomprehensible
lit. to have one's hands bound and be unable to do anything about it (idiom); fig. helpless in the face of a crisis
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
not the least bit concerned/completely indifferent
different routes to the same destination (idiom); fig. different means of achieve the same end
to depart from/to deviate from/deviation
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
to judge
circumstances
to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
to criticize harshly/to excoriate
